articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's President Xi Jinping arrives in Macau on Wednesday to mark a quarter century of Beijing's rule over the former Portuguese enclave, and is likely during his three-day visit to urge further diversification from its casino industry.
articles.title: Xi Jinping visits Macau to mark 25 years of Chinese rule

articles.author: Timour Azhari, Anthony Deutsch
articles.description: An international war crimes prosecutor said on Tuesday that evidence emerging from mass grave sites in Syria has exposed a state-run "machinery of death" under toppled leader Bashar al-Assad in which he estimated more than 100,000 people were tortured and murdered since 2013.
articles.title: Syrian mass graves expose "machinery of death" under Assad, top prosecutor says

articles.author: Gram Slattery
articles.description: President-elect Donald Trump's incoming Ukraine envoy will travel to Kyiv and several other European capitals in early January as the next administration tries to bring a swift end to the Russia-Ukraine war, according to two sources with knowledge of the trip's planning.
articles.title: Exclusive: Trump's Ukraine envoy plans January trip to Kyiv, other European capitals

articles.author: David Ljunggren
articles.description: Canada's ruling Liberals lost a special election in the western province of British Columbia, provisional results showed on Tuesday, deepening the political woes of beleaguered Prime Minister Justin Trudeau.
articles.title: Special election loss adds to misery for Canada PM Trudeau

articles.author: Erin Banco, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: An agreement to halt the 14-month-old war in Gaza and free hostages held in the Palestinian enclave could be signed in the coming days with talks in Cairo making progress, sources briefed on the meeting said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Gaza ceasefire talks gain momentum as officials push for deal

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: NATO has taken over coordination of Western military aid to Ukraine from the U.S. as planned, a source said on Tuesday, in a move widely seen as aiming to safeguard the support mechanism against NATO sceptic U.S. President-elect Donald Trump.
articles.title: NATO takes over coordination of military aid to Kyiv from US, source says

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Huge Israeli airstrikes killed extended families in homes in two parts of the northern Gaza Strip on Tuesday, Gaza medics said, with Israel's military saying it had taken out a Hamas weapons storage facility.
articles.title: Israeli airstrikes kill families in two Gaza homes; tanks bear down on Mawasi

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A ceasefire between Turkey and the U.S.-backed Kurdish Syrian forces (SDF) around the northern Syrian city of Manbij has been extended until the end of this week, State Department spokesperson Matthew Miller said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Ceasefire between Turkey and US-backed rebels extended, State Dept says

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: A top U.N. official on Tuesday pushed world powers and Iran to urgently work to restore a 2015 deal that lifted sanctions on Tehran in return for restrictions on its nuclear program, warning that its "success or failure matters to all of us."
articles.title: UN pushes for Iran nuclear deal talks, says 'time of the essence'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un on Tuesday visited a mausoleum for his late father and grandfather Kim Jong Il and Kim Il Sung to pay tribute to his father, state media reported on Wednesday.
articles.title: North Korea's Kim visits family tomb to pay tribute to his father
